comments.author: JeromeTash
comments.body: It's also very likely that Eloy Rivera's verified instagram account got hacked by a goon, who is now using it to advertise and scam people who follow Rivera. They might be fooled into believing the DMs since the account is verified and is probably a public figure. This happens all the time on Twitter and YouTube.Maybe you could team up with other people to report the account so that it gets taken down or temporarily blocked until the owner recovers it.

comments.author: Nwada001
comments.body: One place these scammers make mistakes is in the aspect that they hack people's accounts and use a verified account with a huge number of followers to DM a person, which ordinarily, with the way all these social media celebrities behave, they will hardly DM you over an offer, so sending a DM first is sometimes a red flag. And secondly, hacking the account of someone who has nothing to do with Crypto all of a sudden because they started promoting or advertising some fake airdrops in order to scam the original account owners is also another way to easily identify a hack account and change of ownership. With the rate and manner in which influencer accounts are being hacked on a daily basis, it should at least enlighten people to not believe whatever is being posted by their favorite celebrity without doing a little background research. I was just wondering if the OP has not been familiar with a similar method of scam here in this forum; we could have been talking about another scam victim here.
